alert.note: Alert for Greene; Pickens; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 8:28PM CDT until April 20 at 1:52PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam affecting Greene, Pickens and Sumter Counties. .Weekend rainfall over the Tombigbee River basin will result in rising water levels. A flood warning is now in effect for the Tombigbee River. Another statement will be issued by Sunday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon to early Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 122.0 feet, Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet. At 128.0 feet, Cattle in the area should be moved to higher ground. Flooding of some cabins and camps along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 118.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday afternoon to a crest of 125.2 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 122.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
